verses.verse: Now the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> came unto Jonah<WH3124> the son<WH1121> of Amittai<WH573>, saying<WH559>,
Arise <WH6965>, go<WH3212> to Nineveh<WH5210>, that great<WH1419> city<WH5892>, and cry<WH7121> against it<WH7451>; for their wickedness is come up<WH5927> before me<WH6440>.

But Jonah<WH3124> rose up<WH6965> to flee<WH1272> unto Tarshish<WH8659> from the presence<WH6440> of Jehovah<WH3068>; and he went down<WH3381> to Joppa<WH3305>, and found<WH4672> a ship<WH591> going<WH935> to Tarshish<WH8659>: so he paid<WH5414> the fare<WH7939> thereof<WH3381>, and went down into it<WH935>, to go with them unto Tarshish<WH8659> from the presence<WH6440> of Jehovah<WH3068>.

But Jehovah<WH3068> sent out<WH2904> a great<WH1419> wind<WH7307> upon the sea<WH3220>, and there was a mighty<WH1419> tempest<WH5591> on the sea<WH3220>, so that the ship<WH591> was like<WH2803> to be broken<WH7665>.

Then the mariners<WH4419> were afraid<WH3372>, and cried<WH2199> every man<WH376> unto his god<WH430>; and they cast forth<WH2904> the wares<WH3627> that were in the ship<WH591> into the sea<WH3220>, to lighten<WH7043> it unto them<WH3124>. But Jonah was gone down<WH3381> into the innermost parts<WH3411> of the ship<WH5600>; and he lay<WH7901>, and was fast asleep<WH7290>.

So the shipmaster<WH7227> came<WH7126> to him<WH559>, and said unto him<WH7290>, What meanest thou, O sleeper? arise<WH6965>, call<WH7121> upon thy God<WH430>, if so be that God<WH430> will think<WH6245> upon us<WH6>, that we perish not.

And they said<WH559> every one<WH376> to his fellow<WH7453>, Come<WH3212>, and let us cast<WH5307> lots<WH1486>, that we may know<WH3045> for whose cause<WH7945> this evil<WH7451> is upon us<WH5307>. So they cast lots<WH1486>, and the lot<WH1486> fell<WH5307> upon Jonah<WH3124>.

Then said<WH559> they unto him<WH5046>, Tell us<WH7451>, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil is upon us<WH4399>; what is thine occupation? and whence<WH370> comest<WH935> thou<WH776>? what is thy country? and of what people art thou<WH5971>?
And he said<WH559> unto them<WH5680>, I am a Hebrew; and I fear<WH3373> Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>, who hath made<WH6213> the sea<WH3220> and the dry land<WH3004>.

Then were the men<WH582> exceedingly<WH1419> afraid<WH3372>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH6213>, What is this that thou hast done? For the men<WH582> knew<WH3045> that he was fleeing<WH1272> from the presence<WH6440> of Jehovah<WH3068>, because he had told them<WH5046>.
Then said<WH559> they unto him<WH6213>, What shall we do unto thee<WH3220>, that the sea may be calm<WH8367> unto us<WH3220>? for the sea grew<WH1980> more and more tempestuous<WH5590>.

And he said<WH559> unto them<WH5375>, Take me up, and cast me forth<WH2904> into the sea<WH3220>; so shall the sea<WH3220> be calm<WH8367> unto you<WH3045>: for I know that for my sake<WH7945> this great<WH1419> tempest is upon you<WH5591>.

Nevertheless the men<WH582> rowed hard<WH2864> to get<WH7725> them back to the land<WH3004>; but they could<WH3201> not<WH3220>: for the sea grew<WH1980> more and more tempestuous against them<WH5590>.

Wherefore they cried<WH7121> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, We beseech thee<WH577>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, we beseech thee<WH6>, let us not perish for this man<WH376>'s life<WH5315>, and lay<WH5414> not upon us innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>; for thou<WH3068>, O Jehovah, hast done<WH6213> as it pleased thee<WH2654>.
So they took up<WH5375> Jonah<WH3124>, and cast him forth<WH2904> into the sea<WH3220>; and the sea<WH3220> ceased<WH5975> from its raging<WH2197>.
Then the men<WH582> feared<WH3372> Jehovah<WH3068> exceedingly<WH1419>; and they offered<WH2076> a sacrifice<WH2077> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and made<WH5087> vows<WH5088>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> prepared<WH4487> a great<WH1419> fish<WH1709> to swallow up<WH1104> Jonah<WH3124>; and Jonah<WH3124> was in the belly<WH4578> of the fish<WH1709> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> and three<WH7969> nights<WH3915>.
